learning_outcomes.description: Understand theories, challenges and principles of risk communication
Identify the steps required to plan risk communication
Demonstrate good written risk communication and the principles that underpin it
Understand key issues related to different risk communication formats

assessments.task_description:
This will be a short answer assignment that assesses content presented in Weeks 1 to 4. It will be comprised of short answer questions that require students to apply the knowledge and principles presented in Weeks 1 to 4. The short answer assignment questions will be released at 9am on the Monday of Week 5.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via TurnItIn through the Course site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment gets you to develop written risk communication with the help of Generative AI (Gen AI). You will choose a risk communication scenario, develop a risk communication plan that outlines a purpose and objective, conduct an audience analysis and identify appropriate communication dissemination channels. With the help of Gen AI you will produce written risk communication content and be asked to critique it based on the principles and practices covered in the course. You will also be asked to establish how you checked the accuracy and credibility of any information gathered through Gen AI. The full assessment guidelines and marking rubric will be available in the Assessment 2 folder on the Course Blackboard site.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students are expected to appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
The final assessment asks you to apply the knowledge and principles covered in the course to analyse and understand a real world example of risk communication. Through the case study analysis you can reflect on what was done well and what could have been done better, taking into account the challenges that are inherent in any risk communication process. The assessment requires you to provide a timeline of the risk communication case, describe the risk communication that was conducted, reflect on the challenges faced, and provide an analysis of the extent to which the risk communication reflected principles and practice of good risk communication as they were covered in the course. Conclusions and recommendations for how the risk communication might have been improved should also be included. The full assessment guidelines and marking rubric will be available in the Assessment 2 folder on the Course Blackboard site.
